titleStmt.title: His Majestie's gracious speech to both Houses of Parliament, on Monday, July 8. 1661 Together with the speech of Sir Edward Turner, Kt. Speaker of the Honourable House of Commons.
Speeches. 1661-07-08
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
Turnor, Edward, Sir, 1617-1676.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by John Bill and Christopher Barker, printers to the King's most Excellent Majesty. 1661. At the King's Printing-House in Black-Fryers,

notesStmt.note: At foot of title: Cum privilegio.
The last leaf bears a colophon on recto.

"The speech of Sr Edw. Turner, Kt. Speaker of the Honourable House of Commons to the King's Most Excellent Majesty, delivered on Monday the eighth day of July, 1661" has separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous.
"The speech of Sr Edw. Turner" is identified as Wing T3351 (entry cancelled in Wing 2nd ed.) on UMI microfilm "Early English books, 1641-1700", reel 1899.
Reproductions of the originals in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery (reel 733), and the British Library (part 2 only, reel 1899).

person.persName: the King's most Excellent Majesty. 1661. At the King's Printing-House
